    • Method Detail

      • loadScripts

        private void loadScripts(@Nonnull
                         java.io.File directory)
        Load the scripts from the script directory. Skip the header file. For each script, create a new engine, evaluate the header and the script. Then wrap them in a JavaScriptModule and register it. The name of the register is the name of the file without the extension.
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory that contains the entry points of the modules to load.
        See Also:
        registerScript(String, JavaScriptModule)

      • compileArbitraryScript

        @Nonnull
public javax.script.CompiledScript compileArbitraryScript(@Nonnull
                                                                    java.lang.String script)
                                                             throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Compile an arbitrary script that can be evaluated whenever you want. Not that all of the arbitrary scripts are loaded with the same engine so the code from the previous scripts is still here.
        Parameters:
        script - The script to execute.
        Returns:
        A CompiledScript that can be executed at any time on the global engine.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - If the script fail to compile.

      • compileIsolatedScript

        @Nonnull
public javax.script.CompiledScript compileIsolatedScript(@Nonnull
                                                                   java.lang.String script)
                                                            throws javax.script.ScriptException
        Compile an arbitrary script that can be evaluated whenever you want. Not that the script is compiled in a dedicated engine so there is no interference possible with another script.
        Parameters:
        script - The script to compile.
        Returns:
        A CompiledScript ready.
        Throws:
        javax.script.ScriptException - If the script fail to compile.

      • newNashornEngine

        @Nonnull
public jdk.nashorn.api.scripting.NashornScriptEngine newNashornEngine()
        Create a new NashornScriptEngine.
        Returns:
        A new NashornScriptEngine.

      • registerScript

        public void registerScript(@Nonnull
                           java.lang.String name,
                           @Nonnull
                           JavaScriptModule module)
        Register a JavaScriptModule by an arbitrary name. If the name is already taken, add a suffix with the index of the duplicate.
        Parameters:
        name - The arbitrary name of the module.
        module - The wrapper that holds the module.
        See Also:
        getModuleByName(String)

      • getModuleByName

        @Nullable
public JavaScriptModule getModuleByName(@Nonnull
                                                   java.lang.String name)
        Get a module by its arbitrary name. Usually the name of the file without the extension.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the module to get.
        Returns:
        The module or null if no modules exist with this name.
        See Also:
        registerScript(String, JavaScriptModule)

      • getModules

        @Nonnull
public java.util.Collection<JavaScriptModule> getModules()
        Get a view of the JS modules currently registered.
        Returns:
        An immutable view of the JS modules currently registered.

      • dispatchToModules

        private void dispatchToModules(java.util.function.Consumer<BaseJavaScriptModule> action)

      • onLoad

        public void onLoad(@Nonnull
                   ModuleManager moduleManager,
                   @Nonnull
                   ModularBotBuilder builder)
        Called when the module is loaded in the first place, occurs when the module is registered.
        Parameters:
        moduleManager - The current ModuleManager
        builder - The ModularBotBuilder which is associated.

      • onInitialization

        public void onInitialization()
        Called when the instance of ModularBot is almost created and the ModuleManager is still considered as not initialized (you can still register new modules).

      • onPostInitialization

        public void onPostInitialization()
        Right after Lifecycle.onInitialization(), when the ModuleManager is initialized and no other modules can be registered.

      • onPrepareShards

        public void onPrepareShards()
        Called just before the shards are being created. (Just before the login).

      • onShardsCreated

        public void onShardsCreated()
        Called right after the shards have been created. (Just after the login).

      • onShardsReady

        public void onShardsReady(@Nonnull
                          ModularBot bot)
        Called right after all of the shards have received the ReadyEvent. If you need to do things the the bot come online, put it here. This method MUST call the super.
        Specified by:
        onShardsReady in interface Lifecycle
        Overrides:
        onShardsReady in class BaseModule
        Parameters:
        bot - The associated instance of ModularBot.

      • onShutdownShards

        public void onShutdownShards()
        Called when the shutdown has been initiated, but the shards are still online. If you need to perform a last action on discord, do it here, otherwise wait for Lifecycle.onUnload().

      • onUnload

        public void onUnload()
        Called at the end of the shutdown, or when the module is forced to unload due to an error. If you need to save things or do work locally, do it here.
